intro: Pentanema × savii, commonly known as the hybrid pentanema, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and opposite leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
